availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Flavius Josephus Dehoney (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Son of Willis Dehoney and Lydia Gatewood Dehoney. Married to Martha C. Davis Dehoney in Woodford County, Kentucky, on September 2, 1857. Father of Dudley Ward Dehoney, Temple L. Dehoney, and Margaret Dehoney. Resident in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Scott County in 1862. Farmer in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1863.
